sense.name: climb in a scrambling manner
sense.examples: He skinned up the rope haphazardly. The hikers skinned the mountain in a few grueling hours.

sense.name: bruise or scrape (accidentally)
sense.examples: She skinned her knee. Derek skinned his hand when he fell. Children often skin knees and elbows. I skinned my knee many times as a child, but have no scars. Elbows skin easily when scraped against concrete.

sense.name: remove skin with a knife
sense.examples: The hunter skinned the rabbit for dinner. The woodworker skinned the bark from the wood. I will skin many apples to make applesauce later. Veggies are skinned to reveal soft innards. Elk are skinned for their hide as well as their meat.
